Part 1 of 2I saw a job opening for an Optician that pays \displaystyle\${58},{000} per year salary. Assume that a regular work week for this job is \displaystyle{36} hours, and that you will work \displaystyle{48} weeks in a year.
What is the hourly pay for this job? We will answer the question by converting 58,000 per year into dollars per hour.
If we begin with the fraction \displaystyle\frac{{\${58000}}}{\text{year}}, we can multiply by two unit fractions to complete the conversion. What are these fractions? Choose the correct fractions in the calculation below:
\displaystyle\frac{{\${58000}}}{\text{year}}\times
48 years/1 week
1 week / 48 years
48 weeks/1 year
1 year/48 weeks
\displaystyle\times
1 hour/36 weeks
36 weeks/1 hour
36 hours/1 week
1 week/36 hours
Part 2 of 2 Finally, what is the hourly pay for this job?
Hourly pay = dollars/hour
myopenmath.solution:
D: 1 year/48 weeks
D: 1 week/36 hours
33.56
For this job, we know the following conversion facts:
1 year = 58000 dollars
1 year = 48 weeks
1 week = 36 hours
So, we can convert the yearly rate of 58,000 per year into dollars per hour by the following calculation:
\displaystyle\frac{{\${58000}}}{{\color{red}\cancel{{\text{year}}}}}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ {\color{red}\cancel{{\text{year}}}}}}{{{48}\ {\color{blue}\cancel{{\text{weeks}}}}}}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ {\color{blue}\cancel{{\text{week}}}}}}{{{36}\ \text{hours}}}=\frac{{\${58000}\cdot{1}\cdot{1}}}{{{1}\cdot{48}\cdot{36}\ \text{hours}}}
\displaystyle\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \approx{33.56}\frac{\text{\$}}{\text{hour}}
So, the position pays \displaystyle{33.56} dollars/hour.
